agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: State Affairs TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Monday, April 8, 2019 PLACE: JHR 140 CHAIR: Rep. Dade Phelan ***ALL TESTIMONY WILL BE LIMITED TO 3 MINUTES*** HB 784 Davis, Sarah Relating to conflicts of interest of members of state agency governing boards and governing officers; creating a criminal offense. HB 1198 Shine | et al. Relating to employee-owned companies. HB 1283 Hernandez Relating to the authority of the Department of Information Resources to provide telecommunications services through statewide technology centers. HB 1299 Davis, Sarah Relating to requiring the comptroller of public accounts to establish and maintain a political subdivision disaster expenditure database. HB 1352 Capriglione | et al. Relating to requirements for vendors providing certain services involving computers to governmental entities. HB 1565 Meza Relating to the consideration of ownership interests of certain persons with disabilities in determining whether a business is a historically underutilized business for purposes of state contracting. HB 1566 Meza Relating to the consideration of ownership interests of certain persons in determining whether a business is a historically underutilized business for purposes of state contracting. HB 1924 Blanco Relating to state agency enforcement of laws regulating small businesses. HB 2001 Leach Relating to leave for state employees who are volunteers of certain disaster relief organizations. HB 2459 Capriglione Relating to oversight of and requirements applicable to information resources technology procurement by state agencies. HB 2512 Miller Relating to certain images captured by an unmanned aircraft. HB 2796 Morrison Relating to the use of certain data collected by the Texas Workforce Commission to determine general prevailing wage rates for certain public work contracts. HB 2886 Bucy Relating to the requirement for payment bonds from certain public work contractors. HB 2912 Zerwas | et al. Relating to certain images captured by an unmanned aircraft. HB 3164 Clardy Relating to certain images captured by an unmanned aircraft. HB 3189 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to approval for purchases of property or construction projects by a state agency with self-directed semi-independent status. HB 3265 Capriglione Relating to the execution capability readiness scoring of major information resources projects. HB 3362 Hernandez Relating to the consideration of ownership interests of certain persons with a disability in determining whether a business is a historically underutilized business for purposes of state contracting. HB 3447 Smithee Relating to the content of detailed reports filed by lobbyists and to monetary limits on expenditures by lobbyists. HB 3457 Smithee Relating to the assessment of litigation costs and attorney fees in certain lawsuits under the public information law. HB 3494 Cole Relating to the prosecution of the offense of operation of an unmanned aircraft over certain facilities and to the regulation of unmanned aircraft by certain political subdivisions. HB 3531 Shine Relating to the disqualification of a prosecuting attorney or judge in a case investigated by the public integrity unit of the Texas Rangers. HB 3534 Shine Relating to the disclosure to a law enforcement agency of confidential information relating to a complaint filed with the Texas Ethics Commission; creating a criminal offense. HB 3674 Capriglione Relating to an opportunity to cure a bid, proposal, or offer that does not include a required historically underutilized business subcontracting plan. HB 3852 Longoria Relating to purchasing and contracting by governmental entities; authorizing fees. HB 4074 Blanco Relating to governmental entity commodity and telecommunications contracting and procurement. HB 4084 Walle Relating to the operation of unmanned aircraft over certain facilities; creating a criminal offense. HB 4132 Rodriguez Relating to maintenance and production of electronic public information under the public information law. HB 4159 Capriglione Relating to state programs not funded by appropriations. HB 4309 Zerwas Relating to the transfer of certain functions relating to state employee leave from the state auditor to the comptroller. HB 4321 Davis, Yvonne Relating to certain conflicts of interest of the commissioner of insurance and employees of the Texas Department of Insurance; requiring registration. HB 4322 Davis, Yvonne Relating to prohibited employment of certain former commissioners of insurance and employees of the Texas Department of Insurance; creating an offense. HB 4448 Springer Relating to the use of an unmanned aircraft. HB 4541 Cyrier Relating to the authority over certain real property by the Texas Facilities Commission. HJR 122 Burns Proposing a constitutional amendment to require the legislature to provide for the reimbursement of certain political subdivisions for the implementation of laws that establish, expand, or modify a duty or activity that requires the expenditure of revenue. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
